conbody.p:
Regression is the cohesion, the correlation between two or more variables. There are two variables in simple regression:
an independent variable (in time series, this is the time)
a dependent variable
The investigation on the relationship and the degree of coherence is called regression analysis.

How strong the correlation is, is indicated through the correlation coefficient (R). The closer the value of R at +1 or -1, the stronger the relationship. When there is no relationship between two variables,the value of R is equal to 0.

You always start the analysis by making an XY (Scatter) chart. Then try to find a line with the best fit to the points. This line is called regression line (trend line in Excel). The mathematical equation of the line is called regression equation. The statistical method to determine the regression equation is known as the least squares method.
